subject: Re: [junit] Doubt in Junit
msgSnippet: ... Why do this? If the method is class-level, then there is no need for an instance. ... We need to see the code to be sure of the problem. Meantime, remove
messageBody:
>So said sree on 2003-06-11 --------------------
>Hi folks!
> I'm happy to be a part of this group.
>I need your help to solve a problem.Plz,Do take a little time to help
>me out.
>Thanking You.
>Sincerely,
>Sree.
>
>The case is as follows.
>
>I have ,
>
>class1:Which has a static method that returns a object.
>
>class 2:
> * Extends TestCase(Junit).
> * creates a instance of class1.

Why do this? If the method is class-level, then there is no need for an instance.

> * invokes the above mentioned static method in the testcase.
>
>PROBLEM:The method returns null.

We need to see the code to be sure of the problem. Meantime, remove the instance of class1 from your test case class, because it is not necessary. Perhaps that will make the problem more obvious to you.

>NOTE:The same method works perfectly well if the class does not
>extend TestCase and static method of class1 is invoked in any method
>of class2.

I don't think the method is wrong, but the way your test case is calling it. Show us the code.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
